items.title: The dog run runaround: How volunteers scrap & claw to keep NYC's dog parks running
items.description: "You know, it's kind of a thankless job."

related_authors.biography: Ben Yakas was born and raised in New York, and has worked for Gothamist for over a decade, and WNYC for four years, covering literally everything. He has hung out with Dan Smith (who will teach you guitar), but still has yet to have a guitar lesson with him.

items.title: New Yorkers Think These Are The Best And Worst Dog Runs In NYC
items.description: New Yorkers are passionate about the state of the city's public facilities for dogs.

items.title: Rats, Trash & Tennis Balls: How Would You Rate Your NYC Dog Run?
items.description: We're asking for your help to identify some of the best and worst public dog runs across the five boroughs.

image.caption: Dogs hanging out at the 105th Street Dog Run

related_authors.biography:
Jen Carlson has been an editor with Gothamist since 2004. Her writing has also been published on Jezebel, Deadspin, and a number of composition notebooks before the internet existed. In 2015 she won a spot in the inaugural Amtrak Residency program and traveled the nation via rail. She has an Ed Hardy tattoo, but she can explain.

She is currently an editor and reporter on the NYC Accountability desk in the Gothamist + WNYC newsroom.

Ben Yakas was born and raised in New York, and has worked for Gothamist for over a decade, and WNYC for four years, covering literally everything. He has hung out with Dan Smith (who will teach you guitar), but still has yet to have a guitar lesson with him.

items.title: City Investigating Dog Deaths Possibly Linked To Brooklyn Park
items.description: “New York City dogs are at high risk [for leptospirosis] because of the rat population,” one local vet told WNYC/Gothamist. “Anywhere there’s runoff, you’re at risk.”

image.title: shutterstock_editorial_11749936l.jpg
image.alt: A dog in McCarren Park in 2021.
image.caption: A dog in McCarren Park in 2021.

related_authors.biography: Katherine Fung is a reporter and producer in the newsroom.

items.title: More Ferries & More Dogs Coming To Governors Island This Year
items.description: Governors Island just became more accessible with extended ferry service. And now your dog can go, too.

value.caption: The working dogs of Governors Island.

items.title: MTA Honors Brave Lost Dog Who Ran Through Queens-Midtown Tunnel During Rush Hour (And Officers Who Helped Her)
items.description: You won't want to miss out on the latest indie short film, "Indie The Dog Makes Her Way Through The Queens Midtown Tunnel."

default_image.title: 51263346207_67f1e3fd80_k.jpg
default_image.alt: Photos of MTA Bridges & Tunnels Vice President and Chief of Operations Richard Hildebrand presenting commendations to Sgt. Orlando Caholo and BTO Heather Minutello at the Queens Midtown Tunnel after rescuing the lost dog Indie

items.title: Photos: Wasabi The Pekingese Wins Westminster Dog Show 2021

default_image.title: Westminster Dog Show 2021
default_image.alt: Wasabi sticks out his tongue as he races to walk
default_image.caption: Pekingese walks with its handler in the Best in Show at the Westminster Kennel Club dog show, in Tarrytown, N.Y. The dog won the blue ribbon in Best in Show on June 13, 2021

related_authors.biography:
Jen Chung co-created Gothamist in 2002 with Jake Dobkin, establishing it as a website about New York City and everything that happens in it and an essential must-read for New Yorkers. She also launched sites across the country and world, including DCist, LAist, and Londonist. She loves learning about NYC arcana and meeting bodega cats. 

She is currently Senior Editor of NYC Accountability in the Gothamist + WNYC newsroom.

items.title: Fact: These NYC Dogs Are Lovin' All This Snow
items.description: You might not love the 20-40 MPH wind with snow being pelted in your face, but your dog is into it!

default_image.title: Snow dogs February 2021
default_image.alt: An annoyed looking bulldog climbing through the snow
default_image.caption: Possible a mixed reaction to the snow in Crown Heights
